attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Amend the law on stamp duty on your main residence when you own a second home
attributes.background: If you cohabit and separate and want to transfer the main residence to your sole name you have to pay 3% stamp duty on your equity share coupled with your portion of any remaining mortgage when you own a second property.  This law does not apply if you are married so discriminates people cohabiting.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp duty was paid when the house was originally purchased so how can you pay this again when you are not moving?
Why does the rule not apply if you were to sell the property?
Why does being married mean you are exempt?
The revenue state this is because you are increasing your share of property you own?
Surely the additional stamp duty should only be on the increase in market value/equity of the property over and above what you originally paid?

attributes.action: Make older homes comply with new building regs if proven harmful to occupants
attributes.background: In the past new homes were built to conserve energy, one way to this was to make them airtight. A side affect of this was insufficient ventilation, regulations have been changed in recent years to prevent this but older homes continue to harm their occupants with high levels of indoor pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
For 10 years I have owned a shared ownership leasehold apartment that suffers from insufficient ventilation, it has been proved to have very poor airflow but as it was given a completion certificate by the local authority I have been unable to persuade the Housing Association or the Freeholder to allow me to change the windows. 
For 6 years I was poisoned by excessive levels of CO2 that built up in my property while I was sleeping, 4 years ago I left my home and I am still waiting for resolve.

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from goverment control and let it be independently run by experts
attributes.background: take the NHS out of direct government control and allow experts i.e doctors, nurses etc to have a say and run it properly without interference and micro management from Government health secretary Jeremy Hunt

attributes.action: Include Microeconomics in the National Curriculum, beginning in Primary school
attributes.background:
Understanding why we make the decisions we do makes an individual a better decision-maker.
People make poor financial decisions every day, from payday loans to impulse purchases.
Educating the young to make them better decision-making adults is an highly worthwhile investment in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
Microeconomics is a branch of economics that studies the behavior of individuals and firms in making decisions regarding the allocation of limited resources.
It differs from macroeconomics, which is a branch of economics dealing with the performance, structure, behavior, and decision-making of an economy as a whole, rather than individual markets. 
With microeconomics, macroeconomics is one of the two most general fields in economics.

attributes.action: Increase SFE loan for volunteer placement year students in the UK
attributes.background: SFE is there to help students afford their university studies, however the amount offered for a volunteer (unpaid) placement year is considerably lower, making it hard for students to afford living costs. Universities are pushing for students to take placement years yet SFE is making it unaffordable
attributes.additional_details:
Universities and SFE offer varying amounts ranging from £2000 to £2500. According to the NUS average living costs for a student in the UK is £13,388 for living costs
(£6,143 for rent, £1,956 for food, £316 for household goods, £65 for insurance, £2,074 for personal items, £1,524 for travel and £1,310 for leisure).

attributes.action: Make schools more about learning and less about exams
attributes.background: Far too many children are not reaching their potential in schools because they're only rewarded using exams. This isn't the right method of assessment for everyone. Instead, coursework, participation marks and other such methods of assessment should be used to give a more rounded education.

attributes.action: Vendors withdrawing from sales should incur penalties to cover purchasers costs.
attributes.background:
Because of our Vendors decision to withdraw the sale of his property on the day of exchange, we have incurred searches costs,  legal and surveyors fees and now rental costs while we find another property.
We felt obliged to continue, our buyers are due to become parents.

attributes.action: Change the Childcare Act and enable childcare vouchers to be given for relatives
attributes.background: The Department For Education (DFE) allows some parents to claim free childcare for 2 years and for all 3 year olds. At the moment a relative of the child cannot claim this free childcare even if they are an approved childcare provider.
attributes.additional_details: According to the Childcare Act 2006 Childcare is deemed as care for a child that is not provided by a relative. There are many registered childminders who look after their relatives and therefore cannot claim the 15 hours free childcare. However if the child goes to a nursery where a relative works they are allowed to claim free childcare. If a childcare provider is registered and looking after a relative they should be entitled to claim for the free vouchers.

attributes.action: Mandatory first aid course free for parents
attributes.background: So as we all know trying to get to see a gp or get in to a walk in is a absolute nightmare. 2-4 hour wait each and every time. With quite recent events it got me thinking if every parent in the u.k underwent free mandatory first aid training for children it would free up so much time for the NHS.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Options(CSA) to charge a one off fee instead of monthly fees
attributes.background: I feel parents are penalised if they cant work together they shouldn't have to pay continual fees in order to have help in receiving the financial assistance for their child. An initial larger one off payment would be better.When deducting fees monthly the kids are losing out long term its not fair.
attributes.additional_details: I understand that a fee will have to be charged as alot of work goes in to setting up the case but an initial one off fee will be better to help cover the costs.Alot of parents cant work together for a range of reasons including domestic violence,why should our children pay the price of them not being able to work together,they lose out receiving less funds towards their upbringing and quality of life.A one off larger fee should be done to start a new case and carry on maintaining existing ones

attributes.action: Increase spending on front line policing and equip more officers with taser.
attributes.background: Although the police budgets have been protected, the front line policing has taken a massive hit. More money has been distributed to cyber crime etc. If we cannot invest in more officers then invest money in equipping current officers with taser as a safety measure.

attributes.action: Suspend tolls on the M6Toll when roadworks are in place on the M6
attributes.background: M6 roadworks bring traffic chaos to millions of drivers and businesses. More works are halving the capacity and reducing speed to 40mph for 6 months.  Relieve the stress to motorists and cost to business by suspending toll fees on M6Toll during roadworks affecting J11 to J4a.

attributes.action: Standardize the delay repay system formula across all train franchises.
attributes.background: Not all train companies pay out the same percentage compensation per journey for delayed/cancelled trains to season ticket holders. Southeastern divide the amount by 546 journeys a year yet Southern divide the cost by 464 journeys a year. All train companies should have to follow the same formula.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.southeasternrailway.co.uk/contact-us/delay-repay/more-information/ - Annual season ticket counts as 1/546.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/passengers-charter/ - On the passenger charter leaflet an annual season ticket counts as 1/464.

attributes.action: Urgent call for Residential Care Home Act; specific to Elderly Care
attributes.background:
Respectfully, we, the signatories, ask that: 
All parties associated with residential care for the elderly are held legally responsible, therefore, legally accountable: Company Directors, Employees; Local Authority, Local Authority Commissioners, Social Services; Medical Practitioners.
attributes.additional_details:
1.  According to CARE QUALITY COMMISSION, 
18 January 2016, there is NO LEGAL REQUIREMENT for
Registered Residential Care Home Managers, Providers 
to:
- INFORM members of staff, residents, relatives, next of kin that home has been subject to an inspection by CARE QUALITY COMMISSION.
- PROVIDE COPY of CQC INSPECTION REPORT to members of staff, in their ‘mother tongue’; to residents, relatives and next of kin.

2. Recent case has revealed that, seemingly, there is 
NO LEGAL REQUIREMENT for:  
- LOCAL AUTHORITIES to maintain controls, checks and balances of commissioned residential care homes.
- MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS to maintain controls, checks, balances of administration of drugs by residential care homes.

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to have a license to own an axe.
attributes.background: Today a police officer was attacked by someone with an axe.  Why are there not rules for people to own such an offensive weapon.  They are more deadly than firearms, they are silent and can be weilded indiscriminately.

attributes.action: The NHS to provide meals for staff, including staff at Queen's Medical Centre.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to provide meals for the staff at queens medical centre including agency staff that work at qmc. The staff work hard everyday and do not get a option whether they would like a meal, I'm writing this petition to ask you to get the nhs to provide meals for staff at the qmc.
attributes.additional_details: At the present moment if the staff at the queens medical centre eat the hospital food they get fired instantly, At fast food places such as McDonald's, burger king ect the staff get free meals, meanwhile the staff at queens medical centre save people lives everyday and they don't get the option. I would like the nhs to provide ethier free meals for the hospital staff or charge £1.00 per meal as they deserve it.

attributes.action: Plase let Second generations born outside the UK have British Citizenship.
attributes.background: Britain only lets first generations born outside the UK have citizenship. At least one more generation should be elegible like in other countries.
attributes.additional_details: Let a second generation be born outside the UK like when act 1981 was made for first generations by descent.

attributes.action: Allow all British Overseas Territories Citizens become full British/UK citizens
attributes.background: I am from Turks and Caicos Islands, a British overseas territory located in the Caribbean. British Overseas Territories Act 2002 did not allow  all British Overseas Territories Citizens to become full British citizen. I would like all members of parliament to review and vote on this.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament  should amend the British Nationality Act 1981 and the British Overseas Act 2002 to allow all British overseas territories become full British/UK citizens.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for all betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: In recent months there has been a torrent of staff being raped, held at knife point and zero security for the staff working in betting shops and nothing has been done about this. It's time companies that run betting shops are held accountable for the safety of the staff they employ!
attributes.additional_details: Since the release of the new regulations from the government for gambling more and more staff are being put at risk by their employers including a staff member who was raped in a store and more recently members of staff and the public being held at knife point is becoming more and more frequent. No measures have been put in place to protect the staff. One member of staff was held at gunpoint while a robbery took place. It needs to be addressed NOW before people die!!

attributes.action: Allow heating in education to be on in all colder months through more funding
attributes.background: I myself am a student of 16 with asthma. Throught my whole time in education I , along with all my peers , have suffered through the lack of heating. Simply wrapping up warm doesn't work, as breathing in cold air causes illnesses , leading to absents. Please help change this.

attributes.action: Change the funding for preschool so that all children start at age 3.
attributes.background: It is unfair that children who are born at the "wrong time"  miss out on schooling. Children who are born after term start dates have to wait till the next term to start school, meaning that a child who was born just before the term will benefit from funding while a child born after misses out.
attributes.additional_details: It should be that all children should get funding when they turn 3, regardless of term dates.

attributes.action: Outlaw sale of electronics with firmware reflashing code that can be reflashed
attributes.background: For security, require electronic devices with "reflashable" or other alterable firmware to have the section of code that performs the reflashing, and one that correctly downloads the current reflashable firmware contents, stored in Read Only Memory that is electronically impossible to alter.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyber attacks against hardware have begun to take the form of reflashing attacks which modify the firmware of the targeted device.

If the device's capability to be reflashed can itself be removed or tampered with by reflashing, attack code can make itself undetectable and impossible to remove, requiring the entire electronic device to be thrown away.

The proposal would obstruct this form of attack as fixed unchangable code would exist allow reflashing and reporting of flash memory contents.

attributes.action: 80 characters is not enough to express a political request. Extend limit to >999
attributes.background: I want to write a petition to the government not a twitter comment and I want people to understand from the outset what I want and why. Limiting the number of charterers I can write is extremely restrictive to allowing voters to express themselves.

attributes.action: All cyclists to have a basic third party insurance cover.
attributes.background: There are more and more people using bicycles these days and accidents happen. So what happens when a cyclist hits you or your vehicle and the blame is no them? Nothing because they are an uninsured vehicle, It's time for change.

attributes.action: To Exempt Final Year Uni students From Council Tax, For Their Entire Tenancy.
attributes.background: The government demand that final year Uni students pay council tax for the period between the conclusion of final term right up until the end of your tenancy. This is regardless of the length of your contract (often demanded by landlords to be 11 months) and the fact that you signed it as a student.
attributes.additional_details: My housemates and I feel we were not sufficiently warned or provided any clear statements to make us aware of this law and feel that either this approach must be changed, or that the demand for council tax over these outlying months, be removed completely. We want to help raise awareness for other students so that they don't get caught out too. As graduates we don't earn too much straight after University and to be suddenly hit with a bill that we were unaware of is quite stressful.

attributes.action: Repeal the ECA 1972 BEFORE initiating negotiations under Article 50.
attributes.background: It is critical that this repeal occurs before Article 50 stuff starts, since we can then do so under our own rules, rather than those imposed by the European Union.  If this does not happen, the UK will enter the Article 5 negotiations with one hand tied behind its back.
attributes.additional_details:
European Communities Act 1972

Lisbon Treaty

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live Animals in all UK Pet Shops
attributes.background:
It's currently too easy for the general public to impulse buy pets many of which end up being sold, rehomed, surrendered to rescues 
The staff in the pet shops generally do not have the right skills or training for each animal.
All too often profit comes before welfare with many pet shops.
attributes.additional_details:
Many visits to a local (branded) pet shop, none of the staff show any trained skills of being able to deal with each animal 
not knowing how to handle a Budgie or get it out of the cage, 

Sending a Chicken back to the supplier for making "funny nosies" this chicken was going to be sent back to be put down, hanging air freshers in the cages of Rabbits and Chickens.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who experience emission problems with their diesel vehicles
attributes.background: Since 2009 diesel vehicles have been fitted with a diesel particulate filter (DPFs) to remove particles of soot etc from the exhaust to protect the environment and the air we breathe. These filters are failing or becoming clogged up and consumers are being presented with costly repair bills.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally was advised that to repair my Honda Civic which was under 4 years old and had covered 33000 miles the cost would be over £3600. Almost 20% of its cost new. Correspondence with Honda UK proved unsuccessful. Some manufacturers do not include DPF's in their warranties. 

I would like to see Manufacturers being forced to give 
1) A retrospective guarantee on DPF's for a period of 10 years or 150,000 miles
2) To recall all vehicles sold since 2009 and test the DPFs, compensating owners

attributes.action:
Remove the UK from membership of the UN.
This organisation has become a pariah.
attributes.background: The UN has presided over countless deaths of civilians over the years and has lost its way in the new world of aggression where all countries seek are weapons and power. We need a court like system, signed up to by all with real penalties for transgressors.
attributes.additional_details:
I offer history as a witness and evidence. Name one conflict resolved by the UN?
It has become clear since the 1960's that the UN is an organisation mired in politics and self interest. The rules created for countries to debate are being abused in a wholesale and cynical fashion. Their must be a better way by way of a court which member states adhere to or else they are dismissed from the organisation. The bailiffs of the court will be member countries having no interest in the actions at hand and able to use full force to achieve the edicts of the  court. No more should soldiers stand by and witness rape, murder and torture. No more should cynical members be able to abuse the courts decisions with a veto.

attributes.action: Bring back a discounted fee for regular users of the dartford crossing! DART-TAG
attributes.background: The discounted price of £1.67 is not good enough! As an everyday user I now pay roughly £1219.10 a year in crossings, living 10 mins away in erith! Whereas a few roads away in dartford people have the option to pay a £20 yearly fee! This is appalling - there's needs to be support for everyday users.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous dat tag gave the option of discounted prices, not only for local residents but commuters and regular users.

There is no support for those crossing everyday, they are instead paying out Thousands a year, when those locally have the option of a £20 annual fee.

The payments should have been scrapped once the cost of building was settled.

The Dartford Crossing is raking in £3MILLION per week in fines alone as people can not afford this upkeep on top of their cost of living!

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown's ban from entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Due to the incident involving Rihanna in 2009, Chris Brown was banned from entering the United Kingdom as a result of his 5 year probation. 

Chris Brown was relieved of his probation last year and has not had a major run in with the police since.

He has the right to be allowed in the Uk.
attributes.additional_details:
May 27th 2014 - His daughter was born. Chris Brown has proven to be a good role model since the birth of his daughter. 

Chris Brown suffers from Bipolar Disorder and PTSD

attributes.action: Pass legislation to abolish the payment of full council tax on probate property
attributes.background: It seems that councils are now charging 100% council tax on probate properties, irrespective of whether efforts are being made to sell or rent them. Legislation, it seems, will allow them to charge 150% or even 200% next year. This is immoral and unfair and nothing more than another unfair tax.

attributes.action: Stop payroll co.'s charging admin fees to agency workers for processing earnings
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies use payroll companies to process agency worker earnings. The worker is commonly charged up to £20 per week simply to receive their pay! This equates to around £1,000 per year often taken from low paid workers.

attributes.action: Stop employment agencies using incremental holiday pay as part of basic rate.
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies, particularly within the construction industry, agree a basic rate and then make that rate up of a lower basic rate up of a lower rate plus incremental holiday pay. This is common practice, but the law clearly states that holiday pay must be a "true addition" to the basic rate.

attributes.action: BRING BACK THE NIT NURSE
attributes.background: We all know that the little critters are at large within schools. But they have got significantly worse over recent years. Bringing back the nit nurse would give those parents who don't regularly check their children's hair the extra push they need.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on all children involved. I myself have had to treat my daughter 3 times in the 2 weeks she's been back at school. This is almost abuse. Let's help all people involved.

attributes.action: Close or take drastic measures to improve the 111 nhs service.
attributes.background: The NHS 111 service continually provide incorrect information and put people's lives at risk and put extra strain on the hospitals, doctors and the ambulance service. They also don't listen to what the problem is , they read a computer screen.

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: House of Lords/Commons respect the will of people and not stop Article 50
attributes.background: In June the UK voters voted to leave the EU; we were told the result would stand but each day pro EU politicians and supporters try to block our democratic voice. I propose we sign this petition to show the will of the people must be carried out no matter what. Teresa May can invoke Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Todays proposal from the House of Lords just proves the establishment think their views are more important than the 17,410,742 million who voted to leave the EU in a valid referendum.

attributes.action: Raise UK Legal Limit of Stakes For Poker In Pubs To £10 & £20 In Members Clubs
attributes.background:
The gambling act 2005 states: 
Low stakes poker is permitted in pubs, with stakes kept to a maximum of £5 per player, with a £100 max pot per premises per day. 
Low stakes poker in social clubs, with the correct permit, allows a maximum of £10 per player £250 total pot per premises per day
attributes.additional_details:
We're petitioning to change this law to the following:
Low stakes poker to be permitted in pubs with stakes kept to: £10 Maximum per player with no maximum pot, in social clubs: £20 maximum per player no maximum pot (modify the gaming permit licence)
stake limits should now be raised as inflation no longer reflects the outdated limits set in the gambling act 2005 & an unrestricted maximum pot size
We believe that this change to the law would also benefit all UK pubs who are struggling to survive

attributes.action: 10 year automatic sentence for carrying a knife
attributes.background: Anyone caught carrying a knife should be given a standard 10 year jail sentence.

attributes.action: Get rid of the EU flag on cars number plates in Britain
attributes.background: Why is the EU flag on car number plates? It doesn't seem necessary, just a branding from a union trying to control us
attributes.additional_details: There is no need for the European Union to be branded on our cars anyway, I don't see a need for it. It's like the EU will do what ever it takes to claim as much as possible in Europe, they want to own everything! they're turning into the supreme rulers of Europe under our noses controlling us and claiming us as their own We are UK citizens!! our government is a prime minister not a President! and definitely not an EU one!!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to shoot rabbits in the UK.
attributes.background: My rabbit got shot by a farmer whilst it was out in the field whilst i watching him. And it could happen to a lot more people and if you have a pet rabbit it might get shot.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of kittens and puppies in pet shops
attributes.background: It is devastating to see that there are so many stray dogs and cats on the streets these days. Many are due to the fact that people go to pet stores, see an adorable little baby kitten or puppy and buy it on whim then further on down the line become bored and they end up in shelters up for adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent this drastically if pet shops stop selling puppies and kittens. It will force people to go to the shelter and adopt an animal from there or make them think about it instead of buying them on impulse. Some pet shops won't vet the home it is going to, to make sure it's going to the best home possible.
We ask for urgent action to raise awareness & encourage the public to choose a responsibly bred puppy/kitten with history information, or adopt from a legitimate rescue organisation.

attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st £1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st £1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above £1000.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to see if UK citizens wish to keep all their current rights.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that a Referendum be held to see if there is public support for the adoption of new legislation, of whatever kind, by Parliament or other executive means, that will result in the loss or modification of any rights currently held by every UK citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the form of the Referendum should be two questions as follows:

YES. I agree to the adoption by Parliament of new legislation that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK Citizen.

NO. I do not agree to the adoption of new legislation by Parliament that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK citizen.

Currently, Parliament seems set on invoking legislation that will result in the loss of rights by all.

attributes.action: Make ASLs (Bicycle boxes) illegal for motor vehicles to stop or rest in.
attributes.background: The Advanced Stop Line (Bicycle box) is consistently and wrongly used by motor vehicles stop in, despite it not being allowed, it's not a fineable offence unless an officer sees one enter it. They are there for cyclists safety and should be treated like yellow box junctions by motor vehicles.

attributes.action: Ban group interviews for all job applicants in the UK
attributes.background:
In the harsh times we live in, employment and specifically, unemployment is one of the most painful things a person can face.
The indignity of group interviews where people are made to beg around a table for jobs, is unfair.
We need to empower jobseekers, not crush them and ban group interviews.
attributes.additional_details:
Group interviews are by many seen as a lazy recruitment practise, to root out 'unworthy' candidates quickly.
In many cases, I find group interviews to be discriminatory and unfair to certain demographics.
Paid employment is and should be for everyone.
One of the major flaws with group interviews is that introverted personality types are left out in the cold. 
We need to introduce a fairer system that forces employers to evenly and fairly judge ALL potential job candidates.
